meanings.definition: Speaking or spoken incessantly and fluently.
meanings.sent1: She is a volubly storyteller, always sharing tales with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent2: The volubly child never seemed to run out of things to say.
meanings.sent3: The volubly parrot chattered away, entertaining everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her volubly nature made her the life of the party, captivating everyone with her words.
meanings.sent5: The volubly salesman could convince anyone to buy his products with his smooth talk.

meanings.definition: In a manner characterized by a continuous flow of words.
meanings.sent1: She spoke volubly during the presentation, barely pausing for a breath.
meanings.sent2: The professor explained the concept volubly, ensuring everyone understood.
meanings.sent3: The politician volubly promised to fix all the problems in the city, raising eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed volubly through the valley, carrying stories of the land.
meanings.sent5: The music played volubly in the background, creating a lively atmosphere.
